messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2099
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/3/2002 11:00:01 AM Pacific Daylight Time, ... There is the most interesting book called Siblings Without Rivalry: How to Help Kids Live
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/3/2002 11:00:01 AM Pacific Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> And they remind me of that when they are not getting along! <g>
> My kids are extremely passionate, highly active and a force to be
> reckoned with. Nothing is simple when it comes to them, but they
> sure make life interesting!
> Joanna
>

There is the most interesting book called Siblings Without Rivalry: How to
Help Kids Live Together So You Can Live Too, by Adele Faber and Elaine Mazlish
. I very highly recommend this book, it made such a difference when my kids
were having a hard time getting along.
Beth


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
